com.ansca.corona
Class CoronaRuntime

java.lang.Object
  com.ansca.corona.CoronaRuntime

public class CoronaRuntime
extends java.lang.Object

Provides access to a running Corona project and its Lua state.

Method Summary
 LuaState getLuaState()
          Gets the Lua state object that the Corona project's code runs in.
 boolean isRunning()
          Determines if the Corona runtime is currently running its project.
 boolean wasDisposed()
          Determines if the Corona runtime has been disposed of, meaning it was destroyed and can no longer be used.
 boolean wasNotDisposed()
          Determines if the Corona runtime is still available and has not been destroyed yet, which occurs on exit.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

wasDisposed

public boolean wasDisposed()
Determines if the Corona runtime has been disposed of, meaning it was destroyed and can no longer be used. This happens when the Corona runtime exits, which occurs when the CoronaActivity has been destroyed.

Returns:
Returns true if this object was disposed of, meaning it can no longer be used. Returns false if this object is still usable.

wasNotDisposed

public boolean wasNotDisposed()
Determines if the Corona runtime is still available and has not been destroyed yet, which occurs on exit.

Returns:
Returns true if this object is still usable. Returns false if the object was disposed of.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Determines if the Corona runtime is currently running its project.

Returns:
Returns true if the Corona runtime is currently running its project. Returns false if the runtime has been suspended or stopped.

getLuaState

public LuaState getLuaState()
Gets the Lua state object that the Corona project's code runs in. Provides access to all modules, functions, and variables declared in the Corona project's code. This Lua state can be used to add new APIs to the project at run time.

Returns:
Returns a reference to the Lua state object. Returns null if it has not been created yet, which can happen if Corona is currently loading a project.
